event: Rackets came into use and the game began to be called "tennis".
Real tennis declined and new racket sports emerged in England.
Invention of the first lawn mower in Britain led to the preparation of modern-style grass courts.
Harry Gem and Augurio Perera developed a game combining elements of racquets and pelota, founding the world's first tennis club in Leamington Spa.
Wingfield designed and patented a game called sphairistikè, which was soon known as "sticky".
Major Walter Clopton Wingfield patented a court design similar to the current one for stické tennis
British army officer Walter Clopton Wingfield wrote to Harry Gem about his version of lawn tennis.
World's oldest annual tennis tournament took place at Leamington Lawn Tennis Club.
Modern form of tennis originated in Birmingham, England as lawn tennis.
All England Lawn Tennis and Croquet Club held its first championships at Wimbledon.
First American National championship played at Staten Island Cricket Club.
US National Men's Singles Championship (now US Open) held at Newport Casino.
United States National Lawn Tennis Association formed to standardize rules and organize competitions.
US National Women's Singles Championships held in Philadelphia.
French Championships (now French Open) established.
Rules of modern tennis established, with two exceptions: server had to keep one foot on the ground until 1961, and the adoption of the tiebreak in the 1970s.
Davis Cup, an annual competition between men's national teams, was founded
Australian Open established.
International Lawn Tennis Federation (now International Tennis Federation) founded and established three official tournaments as major championships.
Title "World Championship" dropped and "Official Championship" category created for events in Great Britain, France, the US, and Australia.
Comprehensive rules promulgated by the ILTF, with the addition of the tiebreak system.
Bill Johnston considered to have best forehand of all time
C. C. Pyle established the first professional tennis tour
Don Budge has best one-handed backhand
Pancho Segura uses two-handed forehand
International Tennis Hall of Fame founded by Van Alen
Ken Rosewall known for accurate slice backhand
Federation Cup, the analogous competition for women's national teams, was founded
Abandonment of distinction between amateur and professional players, inaugurating the Open Era
Björn Borg, Chris Evert, Jimmy Connors, Mats Wilander, and Marat Safin popularize two-handed backhand
Western forehand makes a strong comeback
Fierce rivalry between Jimmy Connors, Björn Borg, and John McEnroe
Tennis returned to the Olympics as a 21-and-under demonstration event
Tennis reintroduced as a full-medal sport at Seoul Olympics
Maximum length of racket frame shortened to 29 inches
Graf named greatest female player of the 20th century by Associated Press
ITF implemented combined rankings scheme for singles and doubles
Pete Sampras won a then-record of 14 Grand Slam titles
Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal, and Novak Djokovic dominated men's singles tennis
Sports Illustrated named Serena Williams as the greatest female player
Madrid Masters moved to May and onto clay courts, and a new tournament in Shanghai took over Madrid's former indoor October slot.
Tennis Channel ranked Steffi Graf as the greatest female player
Tennis.com panel selected Serena Williams as the greatest female player in the Open Era
Tennis.com poll ranked Graf as the greatest women's tennis player of all time
The Guardian poll ranked Graf as the greatest female tennis player of the past 50 years
Tennis Channel ranked Serena Williams as the greatest female player of all time
WTA rebranded, introducing the WTA 1000 Tournaments, a series of seven tournaments.

date: A competent tennis player has eight basic shots in his or her repertoire
event: the serve, forehand, backhand, volley, half-volley, overhead smash, drop shot, and lob.

date: A tennis match is intended to be continuous
event: No arbitrary delays are permitted. Service is required to occur no more than 20 seconds after the end of the previous point. This is increased to 90 seconds when the players change ends, and a 2-minute break is permitted between sets.
Consists of 40 tournaments.
Consists of 11 tournaments.
top eight players compete at the end of the tennis year
group of nine tournaments, worth 1000 ranking points
Won six French Opens and five straight Wimbledon titles, retired at age 26
Lowest level of tournament administered by the ATP, composed of about 150 events.
Holds Open Era men's singles records of 109 titles, including eight Grand Slams

date: Discussions about greatest female singles player
event: Steffi Graf, Martina Navratilova, Serena Williams
23 major singles tournaments, 389 weeks as world No. 1
softly tapping the ball just over the net
Offered the largest financial incentive to players, with total prize money of US$2,313,975 (2012).
20 major singles tournaments, 310 weeks as world No. 1
Offered prize funds of between US$10,000 and US$15,000, approximately 530 played each year.
Australian Open (played on hardcourts), French Open (played on red clay courts), Wimbledon (played on grass courts), and US Open (played on hardcourts).
hitting the ball on the rise just after it has bounced
ITF conducts junior tour, juniors can establish world ranking and ATP/WTA ranking
hitting the ball high and deep into opponent's court
Attained No. 1 ranking in both singles and doubles, finished career with 77 singles and 78 doubles titles
22 major singles tournaments, 209 weeks as world No. 1
Umpire, line judges, net judge, referee
Novak Djokovic, Rafael Nadal, and Serena Williams use two-handed backhand
Not salaried, must play and finish highly in tournaments to obtain prize money.
Adoption of electronic review technology and point-challenge system known as Hawk-Eye.

date: Return of attempted lob over backhand side
event: high slice, backhand sky-hook, smash
hit out of the air as player approaches the net

date: There are four main stances in modern tennis
event: open, semi-open, closed, and neutral. Each stance involves the player crouching in some manner and allows for different shot selection and power.
Wilson, Head, and Babolat are commonly used racket brands
shot returned to opponent in mid-air before ball bounces
Lowest tier of women's tennis, with fourteen tournaments.
Consists of thirty tournaments.
Consists of fifteen tournaments.
